utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Will you please turn your shirt off?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? I’m giving myself dramatic entrance music. People will know I’m awesome and to be feared.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, right, there’s nothing more awesome and frightening than a man who’s got music blasting from between his nipples.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Stuart, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, you might want to mark your Google calendars. Stan Lee is coming to do a signing on Thursday.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did he finally write a sequel to his autobiography? I’m sure ages 79 through 87 were just action-packed.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No, just a regular comic signing. My uncle is his dermatologist and Stan’s doing him a favour.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t want to know that! How can I possibly discuss with Stan Lee the scientific foundations for interstellar flight on a silver surfboard when part of my brain will be scanning his face for signs of contagious skin disease?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stan Lee does not have a contagious skin disease.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, look who thinks he’s Stuart’s uncle now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can’t believe it. We’re going to meet Stan Lee!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sad to say I taught him those moves.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t decide whether I want Stan Lee to autograph my Journey into Mystery 83, first appearance of Thor or my Fantastic Four number five, first appearance of Dr. Doom. Alex, I’m going to go with what is… you’re a dumbass?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve decided I’m going to have Mr. Lee sign my copy of this month’s Batman.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s crazy. Stan Lee had nothing to do with Batman.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, which is why no one else will ask him to sign one, and I will be the possessor of a unique, albeit confusing, artifact, which will set me apart from the hoi polloi of comic book fandom.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s a great idea, I’m going to get him to sign a Batman as well.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is it about the word unique you don’t understand?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ow! Damn, paper cut. Nothing worse than a paper cut.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, obviously you don’t remember your circumcision.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s Neosporin and Band-Aids in my top desk drawer.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why don’t you keep that stuff in the bathroom?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He does. And in the kitchen. And in the car. And in his pocket.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, but the ones in my pocket are mine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey. Guess who’s going to be at the comic bookstore on Thursday?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, can you give me a hint?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stan Lee.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, Stanley, Stanley, Stanley Tucci?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, Stan Lee.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, oh, Stan Lee! Cool!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You have no idea who he is, do you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course I do. You’re an important part of my life and I pay attention to the things you are interested in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good, good, so, who’s Stan Lee?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, he was on Star Trek.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Star Wars?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, uh, Stan Lee, oh, he was in those goofy kung fu movies you love so much?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s Bruce Lee.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. So, is this Bruce Lee’s nerdy brother, Stan?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, why do you have all these unopened paychecks in your desk?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because most of the things I’m planning to buy haven’t been invented yet.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But there must be thousands of dollars here. Why don’t you put it in the bank?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t trust banks. I believe that when the robots rise up, ATMs will lead the charge.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’ve also got something from the Pasadena Municipal Court.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Undoubtedly yet another snide response to my repeated letters complaining that the flags in front of the courthouse are flying in the wrong order. From left to right, it’s supposed to be federal, state, and then city of Pasadena.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry. You sent more than one letter about that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It bothers me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, this is a summons.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A summons for what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Looks like you ran a red light on Marengo Avenue at 9:30 p.m. on November 16. They got you on a traffic camera. Nice picture.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: November 16? Penny, that’s the evening you fell in your bathtub and I had to drive you to the emergency room.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, it isn’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, it is.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, it isn’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, I have an eidetic memory. Also, that’s a picture of you in the passenger seat holding your dislocated shoulder.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mmm, no, it isn’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, then why is a summons for a traffic violation committed in your car, bearing your license plates, coming to me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, they sent me the ticket. I told them I wasn’t driving and they were all, if it wasn’t you, who was it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So you betrayed me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No! It wasn’t a betrayal. It was more of a can’t afford any more points on my license. I already have to buy my insurance from this place in the Cayman Islands.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But the only reason I was driving your car was because you were in distress and I was rescuing you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, yes, look, and now you have a photo to remember that heroic day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not that big a deal. You just go down to the court on Thursday and you pay the fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not going to pay a fine. That would imply I’m guilty.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You are guilty. That one I liked.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am not guilty. I only have a learner’s permit, Penny was the teacher. When the light turned yellow she said go, go, go, so I went, went, went.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m sorry. I’ll be happy to reimburse you for the fine. You know, as soon as I get a part in a movie or my own TV series.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t need to reimburse me because I’m not paying. On Thursday, I will have my day in court and justice will be done. In fact, I’m going to begin preparing my defence right now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, he’s going to jail.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (after Raj whispers to him)
utterance.content: Oh, that’s right. Thursday is Stan Lee Day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now you see what you’ve done? Because of you, we’re all going to miss Stan Lee.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Whoa! What do you mean all?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you’re my friends. You’ll be standing by my side, supporting me, feeding me legal precedents, and if you had the upper body strength, carrying me out on your shoulders when I’m victorious.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you saying that you will not stand beside me as I plead my case?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s what I’m saying.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow. Uh, Stan Lee, or you in court? Uh, if this was Sophie’s Choice it would’ve been a much shorter movie. No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Raj? You’ll be there, won’t you? All right, then, my so-called friends have forsaken me. So, I guess it’ll just be me and my eyewitness.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, balls.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please try to wear something appropriate. It won’t help my case if the judge is busy trying to read the word Juicy scrawled across your buttocks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny. Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny (opening door)
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s just wrong.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, hold on. Before we get to the courthouse, I’d like to call on your skills as an actress.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve taken the liberty of scripting your appearance on the witness stand because, let’s face it, you’re somewhat of a loose cannon. Now, don’t worry, it’s written in your vernacular. So shall we rehearse?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do I have a choice?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, of course you have a choice. Although we live in a deterministic universe, each individual has free will. Now, sit down. I call your attention to the events of November 16. Do you remember that date?

utterance.speaker: Penny (reading)
utterance.content: Darn tootin’, I do, if the court will excuse my homespun, corn-fed Nebraskan turn of phrase.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excellent. Go on.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The reason that date is, like, so totally fixed in my memory is that I had the privilege to be witness to one of the most heroic acts I’ve ever seen in, like, ever.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And who performed that heroic act?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why, you did, sir. You. Dr. Sheldon Cooper, and may I add, it is a privilege to know you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s no need for compliments, this court is only interested in the facts.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But it is a fact that it’s a privilege to know you. Totally. A teardrop rolls down my cheek?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Only a suggestion. A catch in your throat would work just as well.

utterance.speaker: Penny (pretending to be close to tears)
utterance.content: But it is a fact that it’s a privilege to know you. Totally.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Maybe you should put on your Juicy pants again.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: Pay the cashier. Sheldon Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good morning, Your Honour. Dr. Sheldon Cooper appearing in pro se. That is to say, representing himself.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: I know what it means. I went to law school.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And yet you wound up in traffic court. Anyway, if it would please the court, I’d like to begin with an opening statement.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: The court would advise you to make it quick, as the court had a dicey-looking breakfast burrito this morning and just took an Imodium.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well, a quick opening statement. Like a milking stool, my case rests on three legs. I will demonstrate that I was improperly instructed in driving by a woman whose lack of respect for society borders on the sociopathic. I will argue that the emergency met the legal doctrine of quod est necessarium est licitum, that which is necessary is legal. But first, I will raise a Sixth Amendment issue. I’m unable to confront my accuser, a non-human entity, to wit, a camera. So, to sum up, improper instruction, quod est necessarium est licitum, Sixth Amendment. My milk stool is complete.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: Impressive.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: Guilty. Pay the cashier.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I object. You’re completely ignoring the law.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: No, I’m following the law. I’m ignoring you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? I would point out that I am at the top of my profession, while you preside over the kiddy table of yours.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: Dr. Cooper, before I find you in contempt and throw you in jail, I’m going to give you a chance to apologize for that last remark.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am a scientist. I never apologize for the truth.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s my spot.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can’t wait to ask Stan Lee why he insists on giving all his characters first and last names that start with the same letter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, come on, why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Bruce Banner, Reed Richards, Sue Storm, Stephen Strange, Otto Octavius, Silver Surfer, Peter Parker, oh, and worst of all, J. Jonah Jameson, Jr.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I’m cutting. I’m not gonna talk to Stan Lee after you cheese him off.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (phone rings.)
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon’s in jail.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon’s in jail?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You called it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you think? For doing the same crap he always does, except to a judge. He has to stay in there until he apologizes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So tell him to apologize.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, gee, thanks, Leonard. That didn’t occur to me. If he doesn’t apologize by 5 o’clock he is going to spend the night in jail.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, no, that’s terrible. Ooh, the line’s moving. Got to go. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me? Excuse me, jailor?

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I need to use the restroom.

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: Knock yourself out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s the toilet?

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: Well, it ain’t a wishing well.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please tell the judge I’m ready to apologize.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look at that. To my friend, Leonard, from Stan Lee, Excelsior!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Awesome. Mine says, To my friend, Howard, from Stan Lee, Excelsior!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mine says, To Raj, from Stan Lee.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s ’cause you pissed him off about his character names.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, I didn’t even mention Dum Dum Dugan or Green Goblin, Matt Murdock, Pepper Potts, Victor Von Doom, oh, and worst of all, Millie the Model.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’re home.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey, buddy. How’d it go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know very well how it went.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, but we all want to hear it from you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was found guilty and fined $533.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m going to write you a cheque for that. As long as you promise to put it in your drawer and never cash it, like the others.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I also now have three points on a driver’s licence I do not yet possess, and I was forced to issue an undeserved apology, simply because I refuse to urinate in a stainless steel bowl in front of criminals.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Plus, you didn’t get to meet Stan Lee.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, that’s enough, Howard. The poor guy’s had a tough time. He had to spend the entire afternoon in jail wearing that suit.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re right, so it would be cruel to mention that after he finished signing autographs, Stan Lee took Stuart and us out for gelato.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You had gelato with Stan Lee?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He said we could call him Stan.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Except for Raj.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I hope you’re satisfied, Penny. You are responsible for all the evil that has befallen me today.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I realize that…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not finished. It is because of you that I now have a criminal record, and it is because of you that I missed out on having gelato with Stan Lee.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, maybe you’ll have another chance to have…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no. I will never have another chance to have gelato with Stan Lee because opportunities to have gelato with Stan Lee come but once in a lifetime. The moving finger writes, and having writ, moves on!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Did he just somehow give me the finger?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not just the finger. The moving finger.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Penny. Wow. Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Nothing. I’m just getting ready to close up and head out.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ah. Cool. Got any fun plans?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Big night tonight. Gonna share a can of tuna with the cat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, nice.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Not even my cat. I just feed it. Some nights it doesn’t even show up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Well, I was hoping, um, you could do me a favour.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Sure, yeah, name it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I’m kind of responsible for Sheldon missing Stan Lee, and I really want to make it up to him. So I was hoping you could give me his phone number so maybe I can arrange for them to meet.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry, I don’t have his phone number.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hmm. Damn. All right. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Wait. I have his address.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Great!

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: But I can’t give it to you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Then why did you tell me you had it?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I don’t know. Just chatting. You’re looking at a guy who could very well get stood up by a stray cat tonight.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Stuart. Thanks anyway.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Wait.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Maybe we can make a deal.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What kind of deal?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I will give you the address if you go to my cousin’s wedding with me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re extorting a date out of me?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I kind of have to. The cousin who’s getting married is the cousin I usually go to weddings with.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Can I bring Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Sure. What the hell.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Deal.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: We’ll tell people he’s your cousin.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is Stan Lee’s front door. We were on Stan Lee’s curb, then we were on Stan Lee’s walk, and now we’re at Stan Lee’s front door.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yup.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Lord, you just rang Stan Lee’s doorbell. At Stan Lee’s house. We’re about to go in and have milk and cookies with Stan Lee.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, sweetie, I don’t know if we’re gonna have cookies, or he’s just gonna say hi, or really what’s gonna happen, so just let me talk, and we’ll…

utterance.speaker: Stan Lee (opening door)
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you Stan Lee?

utterance.speaker: Stan Lee
utterance.content: Oh, damn.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. I’m Penny. This is my friend, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We’re not friends at the moment. Depends on how this goes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Right, right. Anyway, Sheldon here is a huge fan of yours, and he was supposed to meet you the other day at the comic book store, but he kind of ended up in jail.

utterance.speaker: Stan Lee
utterance.content: I see. And you thought you’d just come over to my house uninvited?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You said we were invited.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, I said I’m inviting you to come with me to Stan Lee’s house.

utterance.speaker: Stan Lee
utterance.content: You know, you fan boys are unbelievable. Do you think you can just ring my doorbell any time you want? I mean, why don’t you just come on in and watch the Lakers game with me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m not much of a sports fan, but thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry. He doesn’t really understand sarcasm.

utterance.speaker: Stan Lee
utterance.content: Well, I’ll give him something he’ll understand. Joanie, call the police!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Fantastic Four, Daredevil, Invincible Iron Man, Happy Hogan, Curt Connors…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Would you just let it go?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And worst of all, Fin Fang Foom.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (as Sheldon enters)
utterance.content: Hey, where’ve you been?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll tell you where I’ve been. You boys may have had gelato with Stan Lee and gotten autographed comics, but I saw the inside of his house and got an autographed application for a restraining order.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sweet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Plus, I get to hang out with him again at the hearing. This is going to look great hanging next to my restraining order from Leonard Nimoy.
